result.execSummary:
Lonnie L Hudson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Lonnie L Hudson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lonnie L Hudson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:34 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF961 AND 15CM1993. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Suzanne O'Neill. 

EXTRADITION HEARING IN 15CF961. 
State notes deft intends to waive extradition. 
Atty O'Neill presents waiver of extradition form to the COURT for review/approval. 
COURT advises deft regarding rights. 
COURT questions deft and Atty O'Neill regarding waiver of extradition. 
Deft signs waiver of extradition in the presence of the COURT. 
COURT signs waiver of extradition and finds waiver was made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently. 

HEARING IN 15CM1993. 
State moves to dismiss this file. 
No objection. 
COURT grants. 

Adj: 2:38 pm

Includes 15CF961 and 15CM1993.  Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.    Shall not consume alcohol.  No controlled substances.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.
